basics.name: Ibne Farabi Shihab
basics.label: Ph.D. in Computer Science | Lecturer at Dallas College
basics.summary: Ph.D. in Computer Science specializing in AI, Computer Vision, Large Language Models, and Transportation Systems. Experienced researcher and educator with publications in premier conferences including CVPR, ECAI, EMNLP, and ITSC. Expertise in quantum computing applications, reinforcement learning, and synthetic data generation.

work.name: Dallas College
work.summary: Teaching computer science courses with emphasis on practical applications and innovative pedagogy.
highlights: Developed enhanced curriculum and instructional materials
Implemented diverse assessment methods to evaluate student learning
Serving on departmental and college-wide committees

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: Developed Knowledge Graph frameworks and novel embedding models for Amazon's core business operations.
highlights: Developed unified Knowledge Graph framework for diverse datasets
Proposed novel Knowledge Graph Embedding (KGE) model
Pioneered advanced negative sampling techniques for sparse knowledge graphs
Engineered intelligent model recommendation system
Built comprehensive toolkit for reproducible research

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Led multiple funded research projects in AI, computer vision, and transportation safety with Iowa DOT.
highlights: Developed AI-based navigation systems for snowplow operations
Pioneered LLM integration with computer vision for crash narrative generation
Created Quantum Neural Network architectures increasing anomaly detection accuracy by 10%
Published in premier conferences: CVPR, ECAI, EMNLP, ITSC

work.name: SoilSerdem
work.summary: Led machine learning initiatives for precision agriculture and soil mapping.
highlights: Engineered precision Soil Mapping Engine improving accuracy by 35%
Reduced infrastructure costs while increasing processing speed by 20%
Led cross-departmental ML initiatives

work.name: Iowa State University
work.summary: Contributed to curriculum development and taught advanced computer science courses.
highlights: Developed labs and assignments for Machine Learning and Deep Learning courses
Taught Motion Planning for Robotics and Advanced Programming Techniques
Mentored undergraduate and graduate students on research projects

work.name: Etalyc Inc.
work.summary: Developed analytics protocols and ML models for traffic safety and urban planning.
highlights: Improved data processing efficiency and traffic prediction accuracy
Created ML models for pedestrian movement prediction

work.name: University of Vermont
work.summary: Delivered instruction in machine learning and deep learning fundamentals.
highlights: Developed innovative teaching materials and project-based assessments

projects.name: AI-Based Navigation Systems for Snowplow Operations
projects.summary: Developed computer vision and AI systems for real-time crash detection and ADAS enhancement under extreme weather conditions for Iowa DOT.

ADAS enhancement
Extreme weather performance

projects.summary: Pioneered novel frameworks integrating computer vision with Large Language Models for automated crash narrative generation from video data.
highlights: Automated narrative generation
Synthetic crash video simulation
Enhanced model training

projects.name: Quantum Neural Networks for Security
